diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The key findings supporting the diagnosis of appendicitis include a mildly dilated, straightened appendix measuring 7.7 mm with mild wall thickening, located in the right upper quadrant. There was no periappendiceal fat stranding, and other abdominal organs appeared normal. The patient presented with epigastric pain radiating to the back, along with nausea and vomiting, consistent with appendicitis.
